review: It's a bummer that you can't stream Amazon Prime using Chromecast (hint hint, Amazon), but otherwise it's pretty fantastic and so cheap. I no longer have cable and I couldn't be happier about it.

review: It works great with wi-fi. The main dissapointment is that it does not work with the cell phone's "mobile data", meaning access through the smart phone non-wi-fi 3G or 4G data plan, that would allow you to see video content through the tv where you don't have cable/router internet connection (wi-fi).

review: Google with another masterpiece. Takes the apps from your phone and puts them on your TV. I put YouTube on the TV from the Chromecast and even restarted my phone and it still ran on the TV.

review: While Chromecast is inexpensive and has great potential, I am unable to get it to stream in full screen using Amazon Prime. The annoying part is that it's not clear in the help sections of Chromecast that this isn't possible. I just wasted almost an hour trying to get it to work. I know this is not all Google's fault but still it diminishes it's usefulness to me.
